data.title: Cousin's Reunion
data.text:
Just returned from spending 1 night at this wonderful house. Cousins with spouses, some single and myself were all able to stay together in this location. So much better than a hotel! 

The rooms are all very nicely decorated, the beds are very comfortable and we thoroughly enjoyed the front porch.

Would most definitely stay there again.

data.title: A Quaint, Boutique Inn
data.text: The Inn on Main is a cute, boutique hotel in downtown Victoria, TX and if you happen to be visiting it's a great place to stay.  Each suite comes with a sitting area, bedroom and bathroom.  There is a kitchen shared by all residents with cereal, toast and food bars available for breakfast and snacks.  There is history to the building and in the main hall are pictures of old Victoria.  The Inn is in walking distance to many of the old homes and buildings still standing and in use.  You can walk to the park, restaurants, library, theatre and post office.  If you're visiting Victoria and would like a different experience from the usual hotel, this is the place to stay.

data.title: Perfect little home away from hone
data.text:
I called up kinda last minute for a room and was able to get a room comparable in price but exceeding in comfort to any hotel! We stayed in the Travelers Suite which had an adorable little bathroom with two shower heads and a unique striped paint job. The suite was spacious for the two of us. We only stayed one night but it would have been good for an extended stay too. There is a sliding door that could have been closed to accommodate someone sleeping in and another person hanging in the living room area. It seems to have been updated a little from the photos online. Looks nice online but it looks nicer in person. 

The two things I always note about a place (besides cleanliness) is the quality of the towels and the comfort of the bed and both were great. This room had a king bed and a super comfortable mattress topper. 

Although it's technically a "B&B" there is only a small little selection of oatmeal and granola bars for breakfast. This was all fine with us but I just wanted to mention that this wasn't a full spread kind of place.

We didn't have a problem with noise and felt very safe. Our key ring had our room key and a key for the outside door so we could lock everything up. 

SO MUCH better than just staying at a regular hotel!

data.title: wonderful and peaceful
data.text:
We recently stay at one of the extended properties of The Inn On Main. It was one of the most relaxing vacations we have ever had. It was just great for us as a couple. Kitchen had all the appliances we needed including a washer and dryer, relaxing sitting area and comfortable bed all included in the spacious area. A little ways from town but it was perfect location for the area sights we were going to visit.
 Thank you again James for our wonderful time spent at your property.:)

data.title: Fine place to sleep if working downtown
data.text: I was in Victoria for a film festival, which was held pretty much across the street from the Inn.  Perfect location for me as it was within easy walking distance.  The bad part is that most every dining establishment downtown closes at 2pm (even with all the potential customers milling about from the festival -- some would've made a killing had they stayed open).  Instead, the only place to eat or drink was The Pump House, which was an easy $4.70 taxi ride away (or 1.5 mile walk).  The Inn itself is made up of two homes.  My room opened directly onto the outdoor patio and gardens.  There was no breakfast (just continental), so you might be more apt to stay at an actual B&B.  In the 5 nights I was there I never had a single visit from housekeeping.  It would've been nice to have a card in the room to explain this, or warn against throwing your towels on the floor (as I did the first night after showering off the grime from an airline flight), or a number to call if you wanted to receive clean towels.  But, instead, there was nothing and the owners didn't seem to be found anywhere.  Aside from that, the bed was comfortable and linens were clean.  I heard rumors there would be a new Hilton Garden Inn (or equivalent) opening on the same block soon.  If I return to Victoria, that will likely be were I stay.

data.title: Love the Inn on Main
data.text:
I called the proprietor at the last minute for a room and he was able to accommodate us. We stayed in the upstairs room which was very lovely and very clean. The location was great-- we were able to walk to a neat little cafe that used to be a pharmacy when I was a child. Loved our stay and if I need to stay again, I'll be looking forward to staying at the Inn on Main.

MUCH, MUCH better than a regular old mainstream motel-- hands down!!!
